title: Riot Games Employment
body:
Hello everyone,

I wanted to create a discussion to get suggestions on applying to Riot Games, as I have been trying for over 3 years without receiving a single phone call regarding my applications (specifically for Human Resources positions). I am struggling because I feel that my cover letter and resume are both high quality, the only downside is that I have never worked for a video game company. I have over 7 years of management experience, even being an executive at a multi-million dollar resort, but is there any way to even get an interview without ever working in the video game industry?

Thank you for any tips/suggestions!

replies.body:
Give yourself some credit fam. Not working in a video game industry doesn't have to be perceived as negative. It can be perceived as a positive and fresh take on the position you're applying for. 7 years of management experience, an executive at a multi-million dollar resort? These are some pretty badass job experiences and life experiences that any employer would probably value. Being honest, probably not a lot of other people have this experience so take pride in it. It's totally on you on how you brand it and how familiar you are with the kind of work you are investing in. 

PS: If you get the job, please know I'm like your biggest fan and send a ticket to this resort my way *dabs away*

Hello Prynce,

Thank you for your feedback, I greatly appreciate the encouragement! For me, the main difficulty is that there is no way to followup on any applications, as Riot does not provide an option for this. I have even tried to call their main number for their office, but have not had any luck with getting through to anyone. It has been over 3 years of trying, but I do not want to give up as I have dreamed of working with them since i started playing in season 2. 

Feel free to add me in game if you would ever like to play!
-Chase

Hello This Urgot,
